newsitem.title: USA: Northrup King gets Bt corn okay from Japan.
newsitem.headline: Northrup King gets Bt corn okay from Japan.

text.p: Northrup King Co said Tuesday that the Japanese Ministries of Agriculture, Food and Fisheries and of Health and Wellness have granted full approval to import Northrup King's Bt corn, as well as six other biotechnology crops.
Northrup King, a unit of Sandoz AG of Switzerland, said Japan is the largest customer of U.S. corn, importing 635 million bushels in 1995 alone.

The other biotech products receiving Japanese importation approval were herbicide-tolerant soybeans and canola, insect-protected potatoes, and an insect-protected corn developed by Ciba Seeds, a unit of Ciba-Geigy AG.

Japanese clearances involved an extensive eight-month review to evaluate importation of Bt corn and other biotech crops for use as livestock feed, in food and food additives, and for environmental impact.

Ed Shonsey, president of Northrup King, said the Japanese approval assures U.S. farmers of a significant market for their crops. He said the action also "should reassure other importers that Bt corn is safe."

Earlier this year, Northrup King's Bt hybrids received comprehensive approval for sale and use in the United States and Canada, it said. Review of its Bt corn by the European Union is underway and proceeding as expected, it added.
